page.title: 05BARLEY MOW INN
page.content: THE BARLEY MOW STANDS AT THE SOUTHERN END OF THE VILLAGE.THE PRESENT PUBLICAN DONALD SYDNEY PEARCE HAS BEEN LANDLORD FOR THREE MONTHS. THE PUB WAS ONCE A DWELLING PLACE CALLED BROME HALL BECAUSE OF THE BROOM THAT GREW THERE.IN 1652 IT WAS PASSED FROM A HENRY BEAM TO HENRY MEADOWS AND HIS FAMILY .THERE WERE OWNERS BEFORE IT PASSED INTO THE OWNERSHIP OF DAVIS EDRINGTON IN 1744.IT WAS FROM HIS WIDOW THAT WE KNOW THAT THE HOUSE BECAME KNOWN AS THE BARLEY MOW.THIS WAS IN 1760. THE COBBOLD FAMILY BOUGHT IT IN 1766 AND HAVE OWNED VER SINCE.TODAY THE MANAGER OFFERS FACILITIES WHICH INCLUDE FOOD, BARS, POOL TABLE AND DARTS.HE SAYS THAT TODAY IS A "PERIOD OF DISCONTENT AND ANGRY YOUNG PEOPLE". THE PUB APPEARS IN MANY GILES CARTOONS.
